38925641.review:
One of the absolute best introductions into Virtual Reality and my top recommendation for the first game to play (aside form the steamvr tutorial).  Waltz of the Wizard offers a LOT of experimental mechanics for exploring the VR realm to really showcase just how much you can do.  If I was to list off every single detail of what you can do in this game, I'd run out of space in the review box.  So I'll keep it simple.

The graphics of the game are excellent.  Everything has a great texture, design, and coloration.  Despite the really great quality, it runs at a very optimal level on a less than optimal graphics card.  Very little issue with framerate.

You can truly explore the realm like no other.  Make spells, play games, play instruments, and even go on adventures outside of the tower that REALLY change things up.  There's at least a hundred interactive objects that all do something different and secrets to be found in every corner of the game.

The game also allows for a lot of adjustment.  Plenty of options to try and get the hang of the VR world.  Try different motion methods, explore your space, and just enjoy yourself without any true objectives.

38198196.review:
A good fun little game, but not without its flaws, and I ended up feeling slightly underwhelmed by the end.. if only because my expectations were set a little high. (I was expecting it to be a spellcrafting game similar to Magicmaker, Magicka or Mages of Mystralia. It wasn't.) (It's also occured to me that a lot of spellcrafting games begin with M. Huh.)

A few things to note:

1. It doesn't have a way to scale the world or align height. I play VR seated, so this made me feel quite small. One one hand, it was very fun to be child sized and mess around like a child... on the other hand, it made things quite difficult to reach.

2. There's no real way to easily grab items. I kind of got used to the whole Rec Room style of "you can grab items from a bit of a distance", so I was surprised to see it completely absent here (especially when it's magic based! Coulda just called it telekinesis.) This is also slightly annoying as my VR sensors can't actually see my hands when they're close to the floor, so any items which fell off the table I had to just resign to the God of Things That Are On The Floor.

3. Telepath movement is... questionable. Good idea, only moderate execution. I feel like it could have done with a bit of FOV reduction while moving, similar to Sublevel Zero, Vivecraft or Rec Room. I ended up just switching to Teleport movement because I felt a bit uncomfortable after a few minutes moving with Telepath. (And I'm one to use SMOOTH movement in Vivecraft, with FOV reduction, soooo...) And, before you ask, Smooth Movement was an absolute no. I didn't even last five SECONDS with that one.

Despite these minor flaws, I still had fun with it, and it was free so I can't really complain. I especially loved the one spell which just made all objects in the room float and you could use your hands to sort of influence their movement. (Conductor, was it?)

35599400.review:
Recommended experience as an introduction to VR.

[+] The environment is really pleasant to work with as each item seems to have a distinct interaction with the other items / elements part of the room.

[+] Most of the spells (not all) are interesting to work with.

[=] While a single room for not there are 3 remote locations to get access to via interactions with some of the items (globes). These are not the best experiences as reviewed Q4 2017 however they were not bad either.

[=] You will end up researching all the spells but for younger audience a spell book with the recipes that were used would have been a good idea. 

[-] Changing room setup to reorient the room was necessary to play the game as I was initially unable to fully reach the right side of the table in a 220 X 210 cm (7X7 foot) room so hopefully developers will integrate movement / teleportation soon!

Other thoughts:

Started playing the game and was baffled that there were no Telekinesis and Teleportation spells considering this is VR and would be inherent to what a mage would do – this also ties in with the issue mentioned above about the inability to reach object from the right side of the table.

Note: In reaction to the October 5 2017 news update (which is vague on purpose for now), I hope that the developer are considering having the ability to handle more than one spell (one per hand) or the ability to cast them from some sort of inventory! Telekinesis and Teleportation would be crucial updaters as well.

30915725.review:
Waltz of the Wizard is a title that allows you to experience what it is like to be a wizard. In this title, you can interact with everything. For example, firing a crossbow at items make them react in their own individual unique way.

The room is rather lively, as you are guided by a talking skull. There are rats and bats scurrying around, and sometimes, a giant may peer into the tower window, not to mention that moving armor suit.

You can use the ingredients to create spells of various effects. There are 8 types of spells, such as fireball toss and making things float. My favorite is the "Conductor" spell, allowing me to manipulate floating objects to move in the direction i want. I feel like I am Scarlet Witch from Marvel movies when I does that.

There are also world globes. By playing the music instrument when you pick them up, you open up a portal that leads you to the room in the globe. One of the interesting rooms is a judge room where you are observed by the 'gods'. They comment and react in according to your movement (eg crouching) or what you see.

In all, this serves as a very good introductory title for VR beginner to see the potential of VR. I spend about 35 minutes into this title and come off impressed.

30889908.review:
Amazing game but moreover immersive experience. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone with supported VR as one of your first downloads. Two bits of feedback:

1) To the developers: This is my daughters favourite game (out of all including ones MADE for kids) - any chance you could make a "Short Player Mode" like in Job Simulator??

2) To the whole negative community surrouding EULA and collection of ANONYMOUS data: why do you care when the developers know that "some anonymous person somewhere across the globe tried to interact with an object in a way that the developers didn't predict"?? This only serves to improve the VR community and content  as a whole and doesn't affect you (as an identifiable individual) at all - except of course to have something to whine about!

Awesome work Aldin Dynamics!

30421646.review:
Spyware that sends all your motions to their servers for commercial purposes (see EULA)

Update:
Developer implemented an opt-out option. EULA is still too vague and doesn't state when the collected hand and head motion data will be deleted.

Update 2:

Source:

http://www.roadtovr.com/waltz-of-the-wizard-analytics-ghostlive-vr-stats-reveal-surprisingly-twisted-player-behaviour/

"Waltz of the Wizard" didn't only send abstract data about player actions and motion controller usage (for examle: how many times was this button clicked), but recorded the actual motions of headset and controllers in a way that the devs are able to reconstruct the exact movements of the user (their commercial product is called "Ghostline" for a reason).

This is even worse than "Big Brother". In "1984" everyone knew that there is a camera in your appartment. But "Waltz of the Wizard" didn't inform the players that it's recording the usage in such an exact and intrusive way. I've read the EULA back then, but it was very vague and unclear and I made a wrong assumption ("They are not assholes.").

The anonymity is a joke. The Vive tracking is so exact to be able to figure out your identity easily by combining height, arm length and motion patterns. Combining this data with the (internet) IP and all the data that is attached to it by web marketing agencies is very valuable, it's worth real €.

The devs didn't implement their opt-out option out of curtesy. There are laws in the EU that force them to do so.

This is no longer a question if such behaviour is morally good or bad, but if it is / was legal or not!

29026804.review:
详细评测：http://www.xiazong.com/video/937.html
《巫师圆舞曲(Waltz of the Wizard)》是一款主打魔法和音乐的VR虚拟现实游戏，我们可以通过房间内的釜、颅骨和弩等各种物品与游戏世界的物体互动，也可以撕裂空间然后穿越去新的地方旅行，这被宣传成《幻想曲》与《哈利波特》的结合。
进入游戏后你会发现自己身处一个巫师的 塔楼里，周围充斥了大烧锅、骷髅头和弓弩一类的东西。你可以随意捣鼓这些东西，甚至还可以划出一个时间裂缝 状的 传送门 。当然了，巫师的塔楼只是其中一个场景，你还可以去到一个大峡谷中间的天堑上，还有左手握剑右手持盾地 出现在一个幽暗的城堡里。
游戏中的魔法需要我们自己合成，就是把材料、药水都扔进锅里。合成的魔法都会出现在自己的手上。比如在空中画画、牵引物体的魔法等。一共给玩家们提供了八种魔法。游戏充分使用自然输入和虚拟现实。你可以把所有触摸到的物体瞬间变成美丽的蝴蝶。还可以把你想玩的东西让它在空中跳舞。该体验和环境的设计也跟房间得规模和固定的游戏模式相吻合。
作为一款免费游戏，巫师圆舞曲给我们带来的快乐是超过很多付费游戏的，中二的手势，奇妙的魔法，多种多样的配方，以及 时不时出现的彩蛋，都让人眼前一亮。总体而言这款游戏日后的提升空间是非常大的，也是很推荐大家尝试的一款游戏。

28223521.review:
Here is the review I've actually been posting on other sites:

I found a cool experience on my HTC Vive called, "Waltz of the Wizards". Its basically a magical lab simulator. You create potions that have different magical effects, and then you can apply the effect to all of the stuff sitting around in the lab (which is quite a bit). I don't want to get into all of the magics that are available, as figuring them out is part of the "magic" of this experience/game. This is a mostly open world in a single room that you can pretty much move around to interact with anything in the room. And there are things on shelves that are out of reach and all sorts of other room decorations. And using magic you can pretty much play with EVERYTHING in the room. Plus, you can actually use magic to escape the room to go to other "Realms" or Locations. There are various weapons and tools that are around too, and I had a real "Blast" playing with the crossbow, the light sword, and flinging fireballs around. I thought it was neat that they even give you a telescope that actually works within the virtual environment. Altogether, you can probably achieve the main objectives in the game within 10 or 15 minutes. But I have had fun just playing in that room for over an hour. Some of the magical effects are pretty simple in concept, but pretty amazing to see in action. Being in this experience is like llving in a world that is a cross between some of Disney and Pixar's best animated films. I hope they make a more expanded version of this game, but as it is, I really recommend playing with it for a while. Your inner child will really be awakened and full of glee. Its just that much fun..

"If I was a wizard, what would I do in my spare time?" - this is porbably the question that inspired this game...

26724067.review: Fantastic demonstration of what can be done with the Vive! If you've ever wanted to be a wizard and summon magic, this is the closest you will ever get! This is one of the more polished VR experiences currently out. Graphics are fantastic, creative and fully interactive environment where you combine potion ingredients to cast various spells which you can then use to create mayhem in the room, sending items flying. If you like messing around with things a la Job Simulator, there is plenty to mess with... try shooting the giant in the eye when he peers in the window. Cast a spell to grow big and knock far away items down within reach of messing with while small. The talking skull will help you out, be sure to toss him into the fray too. The xylophone portal to other scenes adds additional interest. Super fun, and around 1-3 hours of gameplay for most people seems average... superb for a free game! It almost feels like a crime that this is free, it's better than a lot of things I've paid for. Very impressed by the production of this, they did a great job. 5/5 must grab.

26138957.review: If you've ever wondered what it would be like to be a wizard during his spare time, Waltz of the Wizard is the game for you. This room-scale VR experience allows you to interact with a vast number of objects, cast spells by mixing ingredients, and travel to distant worlds, all from the comfort of your wizard tower. 很有意思的vr作，大好评！

场景几乎只局限于魔法桌前，所以我在给朋友玩的时候看他们玩这个觉得挺无聊的，结果自己试玩感觉就完全不一样了，非常有意思。

桌上有3类共6种药物，需要配出8种魔法来。
这8种魔法非常有意思，有自己变成巨人的，有手摸到的东西都变蝴蝶的，有用手指在虚空画东西然后变成实物的，有给物品加提线木偶效果的，有使物体变轻的，有隔空让物品飞来飞去的，有魔法火球的，还有把东西变成炸烟花的。

桌子上按水晶球演奏乐器还能激活三个不同场景，桌子上还有弩可以乱射引发混乱，望远镜可以望远，烟雾弹，铜管乐器等等等等，房间里各个物品激活后也有各种奇妙效果，花样繁多。

24895906.review:
Unlike most free VR experiences, this has significant depth to it.

The spells alone are really cool, and their intuitive gesture controls make for a very immersive experience.

Beyond the fun spells you learn and unlock, there's so much more to do. You can interact with all the cool little things in the room, which often lead to new discoveries and cool minigames. Perhaps the best example is the set of snow globes that transport you to different places.

Without spoiling too much, each is amazing and shows where VR is going, from the ability to provoke reactions from you, to immersive experiences where the world around you reacts to every action, movement, and even glance.

Have a Vive? Download this. It's mandatory alongside titles like The Lab.

I bought my Vive earlier today and got it started up a few hours ago. My boyfriend and I started with space pirate (I work at microsoft so thats one of the demos we have for people to try, so naturally, thats where we started. I already loved space pirate, we got into that for a little bit, then onto brookhaven demo. Then I started this up..as soon as i put this on , i cant even explain the level of joy I had!
Simply seeing these things on a table in front you, being able to grab them and have haptic feedback, being able to kneel down and look underneath the table for the other objects, even be able to clack different objects together and hear different noises, IS AMAZING. When i dropped a glass bottle, it shattered in front of me, when i threw something it bounced around the room, when i shot a barrel and it exploded, fire rained down upon me. Every single little thing makes you giggle with excitement, all these new experiences are so amazing to feel. Im sitting here now while the boyfriend is still playing... weve been on this game the longest so far, if that tells you anything. This is truly a game that fully utlizes the power of VR! 
Devs..amazing job!!! Please make more content! I will buy all of it!! Thank you for this feeling of childish joy!

Vive専用VRデモ。
プレイヤーは魔術師となり、部屋の色々な仕掛けを触ったり、薬を合成し魔法を作ったり、鉄琴を叩いて別の空間に飛んだりする。

触れたものをすべて蝶にする魔法、重力を操作する魔法、ファイアボールなど、「自分自身が超パワーを使っている感」は他のゲームでは中々味わえないので、Viveを持ってる人にはぜひ遊んで欲しい一品。
ついでに助手の髑髏君は台詞がバリエーション豊かなので、あらゆる手段でイジメてあげよう。

《Waltz of the Wizard》的魔法需要玩家自己在合成，就是把材料、药水都扔进锅里。

合成的魔法都会出现在自己的手上。比如在空中画画、牵引物体的魔法等。《Waltz of the Wizard》一共给玩家们提供了八种魔法。

来自冰岛的 Aldin Dynamics 是一家多平台开发团队，从 2013 年成立以来就专注于行为分析以及尖端技术。除了《Waltz of the Wizard》之外，他们还开发了许多世界知名的 VR 游戏。

23321796.review:
Waltz of the Wizard takes the feel of Secret Shop and combines it with the interactivity of Job Simulator. The result is a mesmerizing experience that has had me come back multiple times just to mess around with all the items in the room.

There is so much that goes on in the tower and so many little “hidden” secrets that I often got distracted (in a good way) from making all the spells.  However, I do feel that there is also a lot of untapped potential here (especially for people with larger play areas) with all the unused items in the room. (or maybe I just haven’t figured out how to use them yet!)  It would be amazing to see some of the various trinkets and artifacts be used elsewhere in the room to unlock new areas or abilities.

As it stands, Waltz of the Wizard is a fantastic experience and is of an amazing quality for a freebie.  It truly makes you feel a bit like Mickey in the Sorcerer’s Apprentice and it genuinely captures the feeling of actually wielding magical powers!  

 10/10, will play again!

39511926.review: grand amount of fun more content with the new holloween update. well optimized which is a huge plus for vr games. cannot recommend this enough. has as little bit of everything. a bit of horror a bit of whimsey some lovely british humor. and just in general fun game. i would recommend this game to be your FIRST vr experience. because you can figure out what you like about vr from it really easily. theres three snow globe scenes. a brigde over an abyss. a hallway with some spoopy ambience. gets tense there for a moment. and the last one i wont spoil. then if you get bored in the tower go through the door grab a sword and bow and get to work clearing a dungeon. absolutely fuckin great game cant recommend it enough.
